definition: fragment/piece/(of a film) to break in the middle of viewing
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91

sentences.english: Maecenas himself wrote both prose and verse, but only fragments survive.
sentences.chinese: 梅塞纳斯自己也写散文与诗歌，但仅有断片传世。

sentences.english: The data come from 23 different provinces, each of which is, in effect, a separate theatre of war.
sentences.chinese: 这些取于23个不同省份的数据，都是战争的断片。

sentences.english: Fragment of chromosome was induced mainly by PYM.
sentences.chinese: PYM处理则以染色体断片为主。

definition: dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
to get drunk and act crazy/roaring drunk
after wine, spit out the truth/in vino veritas
after drinking/under the influence of alcohol
(slang) to target an intoxicated person for sexual assault
